title: PBE: Jungle difficulty increased. All Smites nerfed. ARE YOU SERIOUS?
body:
- Smite now can have stacks (2) BUT the relevant cooldown for the stack is 75s (instead of 60s (and 45s Trailblazer)  from patch 4.20).

- Golems can stun you now

- Gromp deals lower physical damage but poisons you for a huge amount

- Krugs move faster

- Crab gets more health
---------------------------

Because you know... Junglers weren't falling behind enough already.

One gotta put a cover on that coffin' amrite?

replies.body:
Reminder: You're referring to what's on PBE which are experimental.

Much of this, we're doing various thematic explorations of jungle strength (hence the behavior differences of Krug and Gromp). This is MOST DEFINITELY an experiment and even in this experiment it's important to note that smite removes these mechanics off the monster. Basically, smite "steals" their mechanic.
Gameplay wise, we're looking at creative ways to push lane (level 1) poaching back off junglers at high levels of play.



For Scuttler... It's weaker.
The actual change is:
Base health increased by 50.
**Health per level decreased by 150.**
Health now scales with monster level multipliers.
Scuttler now gives increased gold and experience.

Results:
The Scuttler is easier to take at most levels (exception: Level 12 and 13 where Crab is SLIGHTLY tankier, but by trivial amounts).
The Scuttler no longer has an XP penalty for taking it (because it levels with you)
The Scuttler gives more XP and Gold.

> Gameplay wise, we're looking at creative ways to push lane poaching back off junglers at high levels.


You're not going to be able to do that without some massive shifts in how certain classes scale with gold. Basically, until it isn't the case that you want to funnel all your gold into the ADC, and you somehow manage to get junglers to kill a camp faster and more efficiently than said ADC, they're gonna poach camps.

I main jungle and while I like the of Smite buffs the current jungle feels worse for various reasons:

1.) Worse mana sustain on items, but higher monster health (= increased number of spells to kill) -> significant mana issues on many junglers

2.) Long camp cooldowns with high experience per camp
-> Solo lanes who get ahead pre lvl 4 (ab)use this advantage to take the enemy's jungle. This not only catapults them forward against their lane but also knock the jungler out of the game. Up to a point were ganking become suicide.
Note: This experience is mostly limited to playing Platinum and Diamond MMR. Less common with Gold since solo laners tend not to ward the enemy jungle here.

3.) Sustain junglers are too far off the charts compared to others. 
-> Maybe these deserve to be toned down while the jungle difficulty gets slightly decreased at the same time.

Could you explain EXACTLY how the new smite works? because I have heard two different explanations, and since I don't have a PBE account I cannot test it out myself. I have heard that it either works where each charge has its own cool down, meaning you get two smites every 75 seconds (this would be great, since with skill and management, you could stagger your smite use and get roughly half cool down on smite), OR the other thing I have heard ( a lot more frequently, which is concerning) is that the cool downs run one after the other, an as a result, all this effectively does is give you one extra smite early and then nerf it for the whole rest of the game. 

Of those two ideas, the first one seems SO cool and like it could open up possibilities for some serious strategy, like Power farming with it, using one charge to gank while the other recharges, counterjungling with poachers giving ultra low smite CD, etc. The second Idea (which I fear to be the one that is actually in game on the PBE based on the number of "Why U nerf Smite Rito?!?" threads) seems like it doesn't offer any of that strategy and is a straightforward NERF to every junglier who uses smite (All of them). The main problem that I have with these changes is the rift it opens between blue side and purple side. No Adc/support duo is going to care if they get stunned by a camp at lv 1, and even in a scenario where the stun is impact-full you have the possibility of the support tanking then just going B, setting their ADC ahead and barely setting them behind.

In comparison the Gromp camp will destroy two people, since its poison effect will apply to both as they AA it. This means that in tournament play purple side is forced to make a lane switch and guess which lane gets shafted by that (again). It also limits jungle paths and therefore limits junglers, as the only place you can really start is the Gromp, as your duo will be taking Krugs. While this would seem to favour tanks it's actually a huge disadvantage as any invading jungler can predict your pathing, thus feeding back into the Lee Sin/Kha'zix meta even more.

Overall if you want to reduce early poaching from lanes there are a few changes that I feel you could make

* Increase all large monsters AD by ~30, add a flat damage reduction of equal magnitude from large monsters to machete, possibly reduce per level AD somewhat.
* Take some of the base XP off of camps and make machete give the same amount as bonus experience. Possibly make tier 2 upgrades give 1.25x XP or increase XP scaling, as at the moment jungle feels highly unrewarding in terms of both gold and XP for such a hard role.
* Have camps spawn at Lv 1 only with a passive "deal bonus %HP based magic/true damage in a dot to any champ without smite/machete the duration of the debuff goes up with each autoattack sustained this bonus is lost after the camps first death." this would likely be around 3-5% to be punishing to people attempting to poach a camp, the first AA can apply it for 1-2 ticks so if a hit is sustained during a leash or follow the champ doesn't lose huge amounts of HP.

The jungle is dangerous now, but it's gone from a safe farm spot for junglers, to a moderate farm spot for junglers, to a farm spot for laners with this change. Laners can go into the enemy jungle if there is an early ward, predict that junglers path and secure a kill for themselves easy. Dont forget lane smiting isn't really "horrible" for some champs and while lanes wont need to use a smite to basically make it hell for the enemy jungler in his own jungler, they sure have the option to. 

For ranked Teams and Pro play this would be "great", because it would really separate the great coordinated teams from the mediocre ones, but in solo queue it's gonna be anything but. Junglers in Solo queue are more or less abused, no one works with them honestly unless it's a premade duo and this jungle change would only benefit teams who are willing to help their jungler by shutting the other jungler down. 

It's one heck of a tall task to put this much pressure into the jungle position while ALSO making a majority of them weak in their own jungle. These changes will make junglers look like secondary supports and mid laners look like psuedo-adc's. You will essentially have two duo lanes in game.

You start out with two charges of smite so it's actually easier.

Currently you get your 3rd smite at 120 seconds after starting the jungle. Then you get your 4th smite at 180 seconds.

With the charges, you will get your 3rd smite at 75 seconds and the 4th one at 150. Massive buff to the first clear.

It takes so long for the new smite to fall behind on cooldown that you'll already have enough items to comfortably clear without smite.

It's not as much as a nerf as you may think. While backing/ganking ect you're still recharging stacks, so you can end up back in the jungle with 2 full.

It also allows junglers that pick up the PvP items to always have a smite up while still being able to use them in the jungle. There's a 15 second CD between uses, so they covered the abuse case with those items as well (and enemy team can still try to dragon if they saw you use smite).

(source: played around with it on PBE. Was kinda nice tbh, especially if I had to leave the jungle for any period of time.)
